page.title: 09FARMING _ MASHBURY
page.content: Land in this area is mainly used for arable farming. The crops include winter wheat, spring wheat, barley, oil-seed rape, peas, potatoes, beans, and a small amount of permanent pasture. The soil is fertile boulder clay and the relief slightly undulating. Livestock are very limited consisting of a few cows, pigs and chickens. All farms have a least one tractor and maybe a combine harvester, but contractors are quite often used for this purpose as hiring can often be less expensive. Due to the use of machinery little labour is used, farms genarally employ about two permanent workers. The farming is very{intensive}. *********************
